titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Dollins Collection,
titlestmt.author: Miranda Burnett

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from being created directly into EAD, created by Margaret Marsh, 27 August 2024

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Dollins Collection,
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Albemarle Charlottesville Historical Society MS 713
titlepage.publisher: Albemarle Charlotesville Historical Society. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.origination: John B. Dollins; Malinda Dollins; John S. White; Lucinda White; Jerry Winn; Florence Winn; J. W. Barber

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dollins Collection, MS 713, Albemarle Charlottesville Historical Society

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by Patricia B. Sutker in December of 2020.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: John B. Dollins was born September 21, 1826 and died December 9, 1920.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection of consists of receipts, some correspondence, a weather ledger, and miscellaneous documents.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically and chronologically.
Box 1
f. 1: Accession folder
f. 2: Advertisements, 1867-1899, and undated:
F. M. Wills, Pharmaceutist, Charlottesville, 1867
L. Levy, General Commission Merchant, 1881 and undated
Latest Styles Hats and Bonnets and Fashionable Novelties, Rockfish Mills, Afton, undated
Fred T. Andrew, Dealer in Boots, Shoes and Rubbers, C'ville, VA, undated
The R. J. Ruth Co., Manufacturers of Fertilizers, 1886
The Letterman Company Department Store, Charlottesville, VA, 1899
T. F. Parks and Co., New York, 1899
D. Crossley and Sons, Fruit and Commissions Merchants, 1899
White Bros. Newport News, VA, undated
Macys, undated
f. 3: Barber, J. W. announcement of his candidacy to the office of constable of Samuel Miller Township, 1879
f. 4: Barksdale, William - receipts, 1872-1873, undated
f. 5: Dollins Family - correspondence, 1880-1885, undated
f. 6: Dollins Family Memorabilia - poems, lines assignment, undated
f. 7: Dollins, John B. and Malinda - correspondence, undated
f. 8-14: Dollins, John B. - accounts, notes receipts, 1831-1921, undated (7 folders)
f. 15: Dollins, John B. - Confederate States of America, War Department permission to visit, March 21, 1862
f. 16: Dollins, John B. - Will, March 1890
f. 17: Dollins, Malinda - correspondence, 1833-1883
f. 18: Robertson, James and Mathew - Plat, Albemarle County, VA, 1799
f. 19: White, John S. - receipts and circular, 1856-1871
f. 20: White, Lucinda Martin - receipts, 1867-1884
f. 21: White, Lucinda Martin - miscellaneous notes, letters, contract, recipe, 1867-1880
f. 22: Winn, Jerry and Florence (Afton, VA) - correspondence, receipts, 1873-1926
f. 23: Memorabilia found in ledger
f. 24: Bound ledger book with "day book," "cash book," "sales book," (1860-1861) and weather entries, 1882-1891
